title:

  in proton-proton collisions

abstract:
The first study of $J/\psi\phi$ production in diffractive processes in
proton-proton collisions is presented. The study is based on an LHCb dataset
recorded at centre-of-mass energy of 13 TeV, corresponding to an integrated
luminosity of 5 fb$^{-1}$. The data disfavour a nonresonant $J/\psi\phi$
production but are consistent with a resonant model including several resonant
states observed previously only in $B^+ \to J/\psi\phi K^+$ decays. The
$\chi_{c0}(4500)$ state is observed with a significance over $5\sigma$ and the
$\chi_{c1}(4274)$ is confirmed with a significance of more than $4\sigma$.
